judges: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA Present
judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA
AT CHANDIGARH
Civil Writ Petition No.277 of 1996
Date of decision: 7th December, 2009
M/s Indersons Leathers Pvt. Ltd. 
   Petitioner
Versus 
Commissioner, Jalandhar Division and others
  Respondents
CORAM: 
HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA
Present:
Mr. O.P. Hoshiarpuri, Advocate for the petitioner. 
Mr. Anil Kumar Sharma, Addl. AG Punjab 
for the State. 
Mr. H.N.S. Gill, Advocate for PSIEC.
KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA, J. (ORAL)
Present petition has been filed with a prayer that impugned
order (Annexure P-15) dated 7th June, 1994, vide which industrial plot
allotted to the petitioner was resumed, be quashed. 
Mr. S.P. Singh, General Manager (Estates) is present in this
Court, in consonance with the order passed in CWP No.8685 of 2008 on
th November, 2009. The General Manager states that in the present
case, the property was resumed for non-payment of dues. 
Counsel for the petitioner submits that all the dues have been
paid. 
At this stage, Mr. S.P. Singh submits that in case petitioner
pays the amount due in lumpsum, then the site can be restored and 50
percent penal interest will be waived off. 
Civil Writ Petition No.277 of 1996
After hearing counsel for the parties, this Court is of the
opinion that petitioner shall present himself before the Managing Director
on 15th January, 2010. A calculation chart shall be provided to the
petitioner. In case petitioner is willing to pay the amount after 50 percent
penal interest is waived off, within one year in three installments, then the
site shall be restored to the petitioner. If the petitioner is not agreeable and
intends to assail calculation chart and the amount drawn is not acceptable
to him, then the petitioner may challenge the calculation chart by filing a
fresh writ petition. Needless to say, the petitioner will be at liberty to raise
all pleas, including those which have been raised in the present petition. 
With the observations made above, present writ petition is
disposed of.
[KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA]
JUDGE 
December 7, 2009
rps
